titleStmt.title: A most excellent hystorie, of the institution and firste beginning of Christian princes, and the originall of kingdomes wherunto is annexed a treatise of peace and warre, and another of the dignitie of mariage. Very necessarie to be red, not only of all nobilitie and gentlemen, but also of euery publike persone. First written in Latin by Chelidonius Tigurinus, after translated into French by Peter Bouaisteau of Naunts in Brittaine, and now englished by Iames Chillester, Londoner. Séen and allowed according to the order appointed.
Histoire de Chelidonius Tigurinus sur l'institution des princes chrestiens, & origine des royaumes. English
titleStmt.author: Chelidonius, Tigurinus.
Boaistuau, Pierre, d. 1566.
Chillester, James.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by H. Bynneman dvvelling in Knightrider streat, at the signe of the Marmayd,

notesStmt.note: Chelidonius Tigurinus is probably a pseudonym.
Translation of: L'histoire de Chelidonius Tigurinus sur l'institution des princes chrestiens, & origine des royaumes.
The prologue, "A treatise of peace and war", and "Of the dignitie of mariage" are by Boaistuau.
Identified as STC 3165 on UMI microfilm reel 176.
Reproductions of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 176 and at reel 1343 (same copy filmed twice).
